zyklone.LEDCloud

Class LEDCloud

  • java.lang.Object
    • zyklone.LEDCloud.LEDCloud
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LEDCloud
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class handles the clouds different modes and is in charge of applying changes to the led-matrix depending on the current mode. This class is a runnable and should therefore be run in its own thread. The mode along with other necessary information (e.g. alarm time), may be changed from outside the thread through the use of corresponding methods. Changes to the cloud's LED-strip are mostly applied via the use of so-called pictures, which are nothing more than two-dimensional arrays of Color-objects. These pictures are sent to the classes LedMeshCoordinator, which sends the corresponding commands to the cloud's LED-strip in the correct order. The position of each LED in the matrix can be set via a file (./order.json) which is parsed at startup.
    Author:
    Zyklone

      void addPattern()
      Tells the cloud to create (and display, if the correct mode is enabled) an additional pattern (dot, wall or wave).

      Creates a new pattern and adds it to the patterns-list.
      The type of pattern to be added is randomly chosen and the chance for each type to be selected is weighted differently.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LEDCloud

        public LEDCloud()
        Tries to read the file containing the led positioning information (./order.json), parse it and create a Ws281xLedStrip instance as well as a LedMeshCoordinator instance from the parsed information. The corresponding class attributes as well as the maximum values for the cloud's LED-matrix (meshSizeX, meshSizeY) are set accordingly. Lastly, a BackgroundPattern is added to the list of patterns.

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:
        mesh - the collection of pixels (FieldPosition)

      • importLedMeshOrder

        private void importLedMeshOrder()
        Tries to read the file containing the led positioning information (./order.json), parse it and create a Ws281xLedStrip instance as well as a LedMeshCoordinator instance from the parsed information. The corresponding class attributes as well as the maximum values for the cloud's LED-matrix (meshSizeX, meshSizeY) are set accordingly.

      • playNotification

        public void playNotification(java.awt.Color col)
        Sets the Cloud to flash all LEDs 2 times with the specified color and then restore its prior state.
        Parameters:
        col - the color of the notification-flashes

      • setAlarm

        public void setAlarm(java.time.LocalTime time)
        Sets the cloud to wait until the specified time and then play back an alarm animation (4 minutes fade-in, 2 minutes on, increasingly fast flash). The alarm will stay on, until the mode is changed. This means that setting an alarm, while there is already an alarm active, will not have any effect. Instead, the mode should be changed shortly, and then the new alarm should be applied.
        Parameters:
        time - the time, when the alarm animation should be played

      • setMusicMode

        public void setMusicMode()
        This feature is not yet implemented. Sets the Cloud's mode to play patterns along to the recorded audio.

      • playNotification

        private void playNotification()
        Fades out the currently set color if any, then flashes the notification-color 2 times and restores the state prior to the notification.

      • playAlarm

        private void playAlarm()
        Waits until shortly before the alarm-time, slowly fades in a white light, stays there for 2 minutes and then starts flashing the white light, starting off slowly and getting more aggressive as time passes. The cloud will continue to flash the white light until the mode is changed.

      • setFixedColor

        private void setFixedColor()
        Sets the whole Cloud to one color, according to the last set Color-value.

      • fadeOutCurrentPicture

        private void fadeOutCurrentPicture(long timeInMs)
        Fades out the Colors of the last displayed picture over the specified period.
        Parameters:
        timeInMs - the time period over which the picture should be faded out

      • fadeInColor

                         long timeInMs)
        Fades in the given Color from minimum to maximum brightness in the specified amount of time
        Parameters:

        timeInMs - the amount of time in which the Color should be faded from minimum to maximum brightness

      • fadeOutColor

        private void fadeOutColor(java.awt.Color col,
                          long timeInMs)
        Fades out the given Color from maximum to minimum brightness in the specified amount of time
        Parameters:
        col - the Color to fade out
        timeInMs - the amount of time in which the Color should be faded from maximum to minimum brightness

      • processPatterns

        private void processPatterns()
        Populates the patterns-list with new patterns (by chance, or if there are less than 2), creates a new "dark" picture (2D-array with black color objects), adds each pattern to it, one by one and sends the complete picture (comPic) to the lightstrip. If a pattern has reached its lifetime, it is removed from the patterns-list.

      • run

        public void run()
        Plays an intro and then continuously calculates and displays "pictures" according to the selected mode.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • addPatternToList

        private void addPatternToList()
        Creates a new pattern and adds it to the patterns-list.
        The type of pattern to be added is randomly chosen and the chance for each type to be selected is weighted differently.

      • playIntro

        private void playIntro()
        Plays the RainbowPattern for 5 seconds and then shuts off all LEDs.

      • processMode

        private void processMode()
        Sets / Advances the LEDs according to the last set status, or just waits 500ms if there is nothing to do.
